what_if_analysis.conservative_return: Assuming a blended conservative annual return of 10%, the portfolio grows to ₹19.32 lakhs in 5 years.
what_if_analysis.moderate_return: Assuming a blended moderate annual return of 13%, the portfolio grows to ₹22.11 lakhs in 5 years.
what_if_analysis.optimistic_return: Assuming a blended optimistic annual return of 16%, the portfolio grows to ₹25.25 lakhs in 5 years.

summary: This setup balances growth potential with downside protection through 68% equity exposure (stocks and funds) and 32% stabilizers (FD, gold, debt). Sector and asset diversification help reduce risk. The portfolio aims for healthy compounding while cushioning against market falls. Regular reviews and SIP in mutual funds are recommended.

risk_analysis.mild_crash: A 10% market drop would reduce the portfolio value by ~₹1.2 lakhs (equity sleeve loss), leaving approx ₹10.8 lakhs; stabilizers limit drawdown.
risk_analysis.moderate_crash: A 20% market drop means a ~₹2.4 lakhs dip, portfolio falls to ~₹9.6 lakhs, but debt/gold/FD soften losses.
risk_analysis.severe_crash: A 30% correction could shrink the portfolio by ~₹3.6 lakhs (to ~₹8.4 lakhs), but stabilizers and diversified funds mitigate the drawdown.
risk_analysis.summary: Diversification and strong allocation to non-equity assets cap downside risk; periodic rebalancing and quality picks cushion against market volatility.

education_tips.diversification_importance: Spreading investments across sectors and sleeves protects against sector/market shocks and enhances long-term compounding.
education_tips.long_term_perspective: Market corrections are common; long-term holding taps into the power of compounding and buffers recovery.
education_tips.rebalancing_strategy: Revisit allocations annually; shift profits from winners, reinforce laggards, and adjust to changing market cycles.
education_tips.understanding_risk: Equities have short-term volatility but outperform other assets over long periods; balance risk with stabilizing assets.
